Understate: The claim may be understating the extent of the late-night session by stating that only one bill was being discussed, when in fact there were multiple votes taken after 11 p.m.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the statement that 95 to 98 percent of the business was done by 11 p.m.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the House did not have a late-night session based on the fact that most of the business was concluded by 11 p.m., without considering the votes that took place after that time.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as the expert's investigation found that there were multiple votes taken after 11 p.m., contradicting the claim that only one bill was being discussed.
